us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.interfaces

Interface Orientation2DBasics

  • All Superinterfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, Orientation2DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFrameOrientation2DBasics, FrameOrientation2DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameOrientation2D, Orientation2D

    public interface Orientation2DBasics
extends Orientation2DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
    Write and read interface for a 2D orientation.

    A 2D orientation is in the XY-plane, i.e. the yaw angle about the z-axis.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • setYaw

        void setYaw(double yaw)
        Sets the yaw angle of this orientation 2D.

        Note that the argument is trimmed to be contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        yaw - the new yaw angle value in radians.

      • setToZero

        default void setToZero()
        Sets the yaw angle of this orientation 2D to zero.
        Specified by:
        setToZero in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable

        Specified by:

        default boolean containsNaN()
        Tests if this orientation 2D contains Double.NaN.
        Specified by:
        containsNaN in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable
        Specified by:
        containsNaN in interface Orientation2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        true if this orientation 2D contains a Double.NaN, false otherwise.

      • set

        default void set(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
        Sets this orientation 2D to the other orientation 2D.
        Parameters:
        other - the other orientation 2D. Not modified.

      • set

        default void set(us.ihmc.euclid.orientation.interfaces.Orientation3DReadOnly orientation3DReadOnly)
        Sets this orientation 2D to the yaw angle of the given orientation3DReadOnly.
        Parameters:
        orientation3DReadOnly - the orientation to get the yaw angle from. Not modified.

      • add

        default void add(double yaw)
        Adds the given yaw angle to this orientation 2D:
        this.yaw += yaw

        Note that resulting angle is computed such that it is contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        yaw - the angle to add to this.

      • add

        default void add(double yaw1,
                 double yaw2)
        Sets this orientation 2D to the sum of the two given yaw angles:
        this.yaw = yaw1 + yaw2

        Note that resulting angle is computed such that it is contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        yaw1 - the first yaw angle.
        yaw2 - the second yaw angle.

      • add

        default void add(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
        Adds the other orientation 2D to this:
        this += other

        Note that resulting angle is computed such that it is contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        other - the other orientation 2D to add to this. Not modified.

      • add

        default void add(Orientation2DReadOnly orientation1,
                 Orientation2DReadOnly orientation2)
        Sets this orientation 2D to the sum of the two given orientation 2Ds:
        this = orientation1 + orientation2

        Note that resulting angle is computed such that it is contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        orientation1 - the first orientation 2D. Not modified.
        orientation2 - the second orientation 2D. Not modified.

      • sub

        default void sub(double yaw)
        Subtracts the given yaw angle from this orientation 2D:
        this.yaw -= yaw
        Parameters:
        yaw - the angle to subtract.

      • sub

        default void sub(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
        Subtracts the other orientation 2D from this orientation 2D:
        this -= other

        Note that resulting angle is computed such that it is contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        other - the other orientation 2D to subtract. Not modified.

      • sub

        default void sub(double yaw1,
                 double yaw2)
        Sets this orientation 2D to the difference of the two given yaw angles:
        this.yaw = yaw1 - yaw2

        Note that resulting angle is computed such that it is contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        yaw1 - the first yaw angle.
        yaw2 - the second yaw angle.

      • sub

        default void sub(Orientation2DReadOnly orientation1,
                 Orientation2DReadOnly orientation2)
        Sets this orientation 2D to the difference of the two given orientation 2Ds:
        this = orientation1 - orientation2

        Note that resulting angle is computed such that it is contained in [-pi, pi].

        Parameters:
        orientation1 - the first orientation 2D. Not modified.
        orientation2 - the second orientation 2D. Not modified.

      • interpolate

        default void interpolate(Orientation2DReadOnly other,
                         double alpha)
        Performs a linear interpolation from this to other given the percentage alpha.

        this = (1.0 - alpha) * this + alpha * other

        Parameters:
        other - the other orientation 2D used for the interpolation. Not modified.
        alpha - the percentage used for the interpolation. A value of 0 will result in not modifying this, while a value of 1 is equivalent to setting this to other.

      • interpolate

        default void interpolate(Orientation2DReadOnly orientation1,
                         Orientation2DReadOnly orientation2,
                         double alpha)
        Performs a linear interpolation from orientation1 to orientation2 given the percentage alpha.

        this = (1.0 - alpha) * orientation1 + alpha * orientation2

        Parameters:
        orientation1 - the first orientation 2D used in the interpolation. Not modified.
        orientation2 - the second orientation 2D used in the interpolation. Not modified.
        alpha - the percentage to use for the interpolation. A value of 0 will result in setting this to orientation1, while a value of 1 is equivalent to setting this to orientation2.

      • applyTransform

        void applyTransform(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.interfaces.Transform transform)
        Transforms this orientation 2D by the given transform.

        This is equivalent to extracting the yaw rotation part from the given transform and adding it to this.

        Specified by:
        applyTransform in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
        Parameters:
        transform - the geometric transform to apply on this orientation 2D. Not modified.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if the rotation part of transform is not a transformation in the XY plane.

      • applyInverseTransform

        void applyInverseTransform(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.interfaces.Transform transform)
        Transforms this orientation 2D by the inverse of the given transform.

        This is equivalent to extracting the yaw rotation part from the given transform and subtracting it to this.

        Specified by:
        applyInverseTransform in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
        Parameters:
        transform - the geometric transform to apply on this orientation 2D. Not modified.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if the rotation part of transform is not a transformation in the XY plane.
